item.title: [tut]how to make an autominer(please read again its now an autominer)[tut]
item.dc:creator: @bobby Bobby
item.description:
@bobby wrote:

[quote=“exps35, post:49, topic:139089”]Correct indentation doesn’t add any smoother, or any difference at all really.
It just helps make it look nicer (user friendly, and more professional look/feel).
When you’re writing a script, it helps keep things in order, like which if goes to which end; what lies inside a repeat, etc.

Also, if you have to choose between to scripts, which one are you going to choose? The one that is written line by line, or one that was set up nicely and is easy to understand.[/quote]
I think it is akin to not using puncutaion in a story. sure you will understand it, but its annyoing and incorrect

Read full topic
item.source: [tut]how to make an autominer(please read again its now an autominer)[tut]

item.title: [tut]how to make an autominer(please read again its now an autominer)[tut]
item.dc:creator: @exps35 exps35
item.description:
@exps35 wrote:

Correct indentation doesn’t add any smoother, or any difference at all really.
It just helps make it look nicer (user friendly, and more professional look/feel).
When you’re writing a script, it helps keep things in order, like which if goes to which end; what lies inside a repeat, etc.

Also, if you have to choose between to scripts, which one are you going to choose? The one that is written line by line, or one that was set up nicely and is easy to understand.

Read full topic

item.title: [tut]how to make an autominer(please read again its now an autominer)[tut]
item.dc:creator: @script_owned4 script_owned4
item.description:
@script_owned4 wrote:

I don’t think so.

EDIT:

now we are going to add a const a const is something your script remembers so if we decide to get the script to find a ore and mine it we have the const that way we dont need to ad the color over and over again
so after the include files write const then bellow const write orecolor1=
to get the color of the [u]tree click on the button in the toolbar of scar that looks like an eyedropper the screen will freeze then move the mouse ontop of the ore and click.in the debug box for scar you should see Color Picked: (then the color number) copy the color picked and paste it next to orecolor1=
so your script should look like

Read full topic
